basics.name: Neezcha Dinman
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying at UHM for a BS in Computer Science, I expect to graduate Spring 2020. My goal is to create an inclusive and accessible technological world.

highlights: Created an Excel macro to streamline photo metadata entry.
Compiled research from academic papers into a decision matrix regarding locations of interest for future Mars water extraction missions.
Focus on Mars’ topography and weather.
Presented twice at HESTEMP NASA affiliated conference.
Design and update a website documenting the team’s fulfillment of grant requirements.
Mentored group on budgeting and large scale planning.

volunteer.summary: Heartsaver First Aid CPR AED through The University of Hawai'is KRS 332 Emergency Response class
Activities Assistance: Art Class, “Penelope Project” Play, Bingo, Horse Racing, Spa Day
Commission sales on Hawaiian Jewelry, engravings, wood paddles, and Hawai'ian Weapons

volunteer.position: Blue Prints, College of Engineering at UHM
volunteer.summary: A group of freshmen in the College of Engineering were given parameters and a budget to achieve a goal by solving an open-ended scenario.

volunteer.position: College of Engineering High School Internship Program
volunteer.summary: University of Hawaii Summer Internship Program for High School Students to gain experience working in engineering research labs, company on-site visits, skill-building workshops, culminating in a final presentation.
Assisted in beta testing online certification courses.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Service Learning Award
awards.summary: Scholarship for studying as a full time student during the regular academic semester while regularly volunteering

awards.title: American Society for Quality (ASQ)
awards.summary: Scholarship for students in the STEM fields
